[Wrath demons](/Monsters.aspx?ID=100) are among the most well-known and feared of the Abyss's fiends, but sometimes a wrath demon becomes stunted in size as the result of too many failed rampages, a punishment inflicted by an angry demonic commander or simple ill fortune. These smaller wrath demons, not much larger than humans, are typically slaughtered quickly by their larger kin, but rarely a group of undersized vrocks can gather in numbers large enough to form a wrath riot. **[Recall Knowledge - Fiend](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 40 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 35 [Wrath Riot](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2526) **Source** [Pathfinder #191: The Destiny War](/Sources.aspx?ID=199) pg. 83 **Perception** +28; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Abyssal](/Languages.aspx?ID=12), [Celestial](/Languages.aspx?ID=16), [Draconic](/Languages.aspx?ID=2); [telepathy](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=37) 100 feet **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +29, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +30 **Str** +8 **Dex** +5 **Con** +6 **Int** +5 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 39 **Fort** +30 **Ref** +27 **Will** +26 +1 status to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=103) **HP** 300 **Resistances** [electricity](/Traits.aspx?ID=56) 15 **Weaknesses** area damage 20, [cold iron](/Equipment.aspx?ID=375) 15, good 15, [splash](/Traits.aspx?ID=150) damage 15 **[Frightful Presence](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=17)** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [fear](/Traits.aspx?ID=68), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106)) 30 feet, DC 34
**Serenity Vulnerability** A wrath riot thrives on mayhem, and when members of the throng find themselves facing moments of calm, however brief or temporary, the throng suffers. Whenever the wrath riot fails a saving throw against an affect that would normally [fascinate](/Conditions.aspx?ID=14), [fatigue](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15), [paralyze](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [restrain](/Conditions.aspx?ID=33), or [slow](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) at least four creatures, the troop takes 3d6+10 mental damage
**Spores of Wrath** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126)) 5 feet. Non-[demons](/Traits.aspx?ID=42) that start their turn in the aura take 4d8 poison damage. Each creature damaged this way must succeed at a DC 34 Fortitude save or take 2d8 [persistent piercing damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) as the spores penetrate its skin and grow into thick, green vines. The vines cease growing after 10 rounds, and they wither away in 1d4 days if not shaved off before then. The vines can be destroyed if the creature is affected by a [good](/Traits.aspx?ID=83) spell or if [_holy water_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=245) is applied to the vines (with an Interact action).
**[Troop Defenses](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=44)** --- **Speed** 25 feet, fly 35 feet **Beaks, Claws, and Talons** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** The throng furiously tears at each enemy within its squares and within 5 feet (DC 37 Reflex save). Damage depends on the number of actions.
**Damage** 1d12+14 slashing plus 1d6 evil
**Damage** 2d12+14 slashing plus 1d6 evil
**Damage** 3d12+14 slashing plus 1d6 evil **Demonic Tide** A wrath riot is less organized and more vicious than most troops. They can move into other creatures' spaces, and other creatures can move into their spaces. Their spaces are difficult terrain to non-[demon](/Traits.aspx?ID=42) creatures. The first time during a turn that a creature hostile to the throng willingly moves into their space, that creature is subjected to the one-action version of Beaks, Claws, and Talons. **Festival of Ruin** **Frequency** once per round; **Effect** Each non-[demon](/Traits.aspx?ID=42) creature in the throng or within a 20-foot emanation from it takes damage based on the number of actions used (DC 37 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save). Damage depends on the number of actions.
**Damage** 4d6 electricity
**Damage** 8d6 electricity
**Damage** 12d6 electricity **[Form Up](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=43)** **Troop Movement** Whenever the riot Strides, they first [Form Up](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=43) as a free action to condense into a 20-foot-by-20-foot area (minus any missing squares), then moves up to their Speed.
name: Wrath Riot
